description:
Surface sensible heat released at the elevation above 500m over the Tibetan Plateau (TIP) is not allowed to heat the atmosphere. 
Other settings are the same as the standard DECK AMIP simulation. 
Minimum number of integrations is 1.
keywords: GMMIP, Tier 3, TIP-NSH, TIP, 500m, Tibetan Plateau, zero sensible heat
long_name: AMIP SSTs with Tibetan Plateau elevation capped at 500m and no sensible heat flux above 500m
rationale: To compare the impact of removing TIP thermal effects, therefore the DTIP-DSH circulation pattern reflects the impacts of mechanical forcing.

requirements.description: Historical, Recent past, since satellite observations have been available
requirements.label: 1979-2014 36yrs

requirements.description: Modify the surface sensible heat flux of the Tibetan Plateau (TIP).  The sensible heating on topography is removed (by setting the vertical diffusive heating term in the atmospheric thermodynamic equation to zero) where the topography is above 500m in the following regions: 35°-45°N, 25°-50°E; 30°-35°N, 40°-50°E; 20°-45°N, 50°-70°E; 15°-45°N, 70°-110°E.
requirements.keywords: TIP, 500m, Tibetan Plateau, zero sensible heat
requirements.label: TIP 500 No Sensible Heat
